newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan farmers' group to double gasoline imports.
newsitem.headline: Japan farmers' group to double gasoline imports.

text.p: Japan's National Federation of Agricultural Cooperative Associations said on Wednesday it will almost double its gasoline imports from South Korea to 130,000 kilolitres (kl) in its fiscal year which started in July.
"Our gasoline imports this fiscal year will total 130,000 kl, up from last (fiscal) year's 70,000 kl now that the revamping of our import terminals has been completed," a federation spokesman said.
The farmers' group, which has about 4,900 gasoline stations nationwide, operates import terminals in Sendai on the Pacific coast, and in Kanazawa and Niigata, both on the Sea of Japan coast.
The federation has started importing gasoline from South Korea's Yukong Ltd following Japan's deregulation of oil product imports in April 1996.
Yukong is expected to remain the sole supplier of imported gasoline to the federation this fiscal year, the spokesman added.
